Reviews.Title: “Not that bad as the reviewers said here..”
Reviews.Author: Serkan D
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, I was thinking not to stay in this hotel. But then I stayed there for 6 nights with my wife. The hotel was very clean. The reception desk was very fast. All the staff in the hotel was very very friendly. The room's quality was good. It was very clean, we didn't have any problem at all in the room. The quality of service is fantastic. The only problem is with the opening hours of Fitness Center. Although it's explicitly stated that the opening time of Fitness Center is at 7am, it's opened at 8am. The view is very nice, that you can see the Bosphorus (Our room was at 13th floor).

Reviews.Title: “Nice wellness and location”
Reviews.Author: Kristof M
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent with a superb view on the Bosporus. The wellness and fitnes are more than decent. The rooms are fine and the restaurant is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Alybaba786
Reviews.Content: Stayed on executive floor. Large room, nice bathroom. However, no climate control, and windows don't open. So choice is warm or hotter making room uncomfortable at times. Lounge is mediocre. Breakfast buffet is decent. Overall, rooms are clean, and staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pretends to be 5 star but is a 3+ only”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanVoyager
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip with a meeting at the hotel. An clear disappointment for several reasons. Electricity outlets on several places are partially loose from the wall, wallpaper has had its best years, bathroom is clean but nothing special ... It's the style we had in the early 1980s. Most annoying is that it's very, very hot ... Had the airco on 12 Celcius but it never got below 20 (it was at 28 when I arrived). The hotel is also far away from sights, cafÃ¨'s and other entertainment. I would pick another place next time, unless they give you a very sweet deal. Nothing wrong with the hotel, but a disappointment when sold as 5 star. See pictures for details.

Reviews.Title: “Great view; shame about the windows”
Reviews.Author: nigelchism
Reviews.Content: The views from the top floor are truly spectacular and worth a visit. Unfortunately I was only on the second floor and the windows were absolutely filthy! The hotel is pretty run down and the bedroom equipment had seen better days. Food was ok and the staff pleasant on the whole, although the front desk all need cheering up!

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TurpieFamily
Reviews.Content: Normally stay at the Hilton decided to stay at Plaza for a change. will now be using this hotel for all my visits to Istanbul. great hotel, great staff, well located and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most”
Reviews.Author: jones4d
Reviews.Content: I had a 2 day stay here over the weekend and before i went read the reviews. I was not expecting much ............ but what i got was very good. The airport shuttle was on time. The hotel check in was smooth and quick. The staff were friendly and obliging. The room on the 10th floor was clean and comfortable. The WiFi was excellent and i logged in easily and outr company VPN is very fussy. The swimming pool was cold but the sauna and hot tub were excellent. I had my first mean in the small bistro area. This was not very good but o/k for the money. Breakfast on Monday was excellent and something for everybody. The second nights meal was in the Pub. This was very good and was simple fresh and tasty. It's worth a trip to the rooftop bar to enjoy the view. All in all i would recommend this hotel. If you dont want to use a taxi into town turn left out of the hotel and walk ~200m. You can buy a Metro Bus ticket (get a double) and hop on a bus to Kabatas, Cost 5TL for a double. From there it's a 2TL tram to anywhere on the network including most of the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Best bed ever”
Reviews.Author: Lana X
Reviews.Content: I was stay in Plaza hotel several times.High building with that split on 2 parts.One part with elevators that located near reception ha good view to Bosphorus if you stay upper 6floor.More high floor you stay-better view. Becouse i always prefer view to ocean,sea or river i was stay in this part always.Big rooms with huge beds.I prefer king size bed instead of Twin beds always.In this hotel single bed so big,that when they put 2 beds together its soooooo huge that it takes time to get out of it :-)))) And you don't feel any hole between 2 beds-like one piece. Most comfortable beds of all my life!!!!And i was staying in more than 700hotels all over the world. Not most beautiful,but most relaxed.I even copied name of turkish company that create this miracle for to buy same mattresses for my home use! When you enter your room the plate full of fruits waiting you in table!Which is quiet nice and helpful when you hungry after flight. There is only one disadvantage of this part of hotel -you cann't open your windows! Its quiet disappointing when you like fresh air and want to enjoy fresh breeze.Hotel staff usually open door to emergency exit that located on open air and fresh wind goes inside floor.But its not that makes you happier. On ground floor you can enjoy very nice sweets in cafe. Room service and house keeping staff are very very nice and friendly and helpful. Receptionists mostly polite but cold. Concision- its business style hotel,not really 5*,but nice 4*. With feeling of being home.

Reviews.Title: “average business travel hotel, noisy”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: Nice place in Istanbul for business trips. Check-in was efficient but rather cold, escorted to the room by the porter. My non-smoking room was clearly a smoking room at some point so you could still smell that. Bed was comfortable, flat screen TV and a small desk also present. Unfortunately my room (on the 8th floor) was rather noisy as insulation of the windows is not really good. Bathroom with limited amenities available, walking closet for clothes. A/C was either on or off, temperature regulation did not work. Did not have time to look at the other facilities. Check-out again, very efficient but cold.

Reviews.Title: “I'will Never again...”
Reviews.Author: EmreC
Reviews.Content: The hotel can not be considered as 5 star hotel, only 3 star with 20 floors. Except the reception, most of the staff was smiling and helpful. But hotel rooms are old, not good ventilated, foods are bad, breakfast was not as good as other Turkish ones. Also there are very limited drinks at sky bar. A board called TMSF is running this hotel now and it stays as government local house. I ordered Kayhan kÃ¶fte and Wiener Schnitzel from room service and both was very very bad. The restaurant at the back street is both cheaper and tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and relaxing view from the Piano Bar”
Reviews.Author: Rahayel
Reviews.Content: It's been a year already, and all what i remember about this hotel is the view from the highest floor. Nothing else special. It's on high hill in Istanbul, but far from the centre. Far from Taxim, far from the centre, and far from the main tourism destinations. Good for a quick business trip in istanbul, not for tourism and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing nice, really”
Reviews.Author: sputnik-dot
Reviews.Content: An average hotel, a cheaper option compared to Movenpick and in similar location. I think it is "5 star" by definition, well, if it was newer, cleaner, better-kept, more friendly - maybe... The rooms dont give an impression of being clean, the aircon is noisy, there is no iron, the breakfast os OK though, and the view from higher rooms and from top-floor breakfast room is spectacular. The staff is not friendly, really the hotel did not leave any positive impression. I am staying there next week again, for 3rd time though, which means, it is no disaster either.

Reviews.Title: “For business travellers, this place fits the bill.”
Reviews.Author: demars
Reviews.Content: Easy location, very close to the highway. Plenty of taxi's driving by, so always easy and quick to catch one. Hotel service overall was satisfactory, but nobody was exceptionally friendly towards us. We felt neither welcomed nor unwelcomed, with two exceptions; the woman who worked in the panorama breakfast bar atop the hotel was very nice and happy to see us each morning, and the person who helped us with taxis each day was very helpful. Rooms were nicely decorated and had all space I needed. The remote for the TV in my room didn't work well. Bed was great! Perfect hardness. We specifically requested non-smoking rooms, but my room was a smoking room...although it didn't smell and I had no problems for my 3 nights there. My colleague also requested a non-smoking room, and actually got it. Even on 16th floor, street noise from traffic was heard through the night, but easily relieved with a pair of super-soft ear plugs. Breakfast buffet was super, in a room with an amazing view over the whole region (this is a must-see when at this hotel). The good: bed was great, breakfast buffet was nice, especially the view. The bad: hotel check-in service and bellhop could take lessons to improve their customer-friendly attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, nice roof bar”
Reviews.Author: groovy_j
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for business. Location is a minus as it is quite far away from the Istanbul Convention Centre. The rooms, however, are ok and staff were friendly. The roof-top bar offers awesome views at night, although a bit pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is a dump”
Reviews.Author: jmsgnewyork
Reviews.Content: While the pictures look nice, the experience was terrible! They clearly tried to a renovation recently, but only upgraded the furniture to look more modern. The wall paper was scratched, dirty and had holes, the carpet was stained and gross brown color and the bathroom was disgusting - marks and scratches all over the tile and I had a leak from the ceiling! Apparently the bathroom flooded above me (or at least that's what I could understand from the woman who came when I called about it) and I was told it was going to be like that for at least an hour (this was at 9:45 PM). The gym doesn't open until 7am, which is pretty late for business travelers and they default to giving you a smoking room with a port hole for a window - it was gross and they charged me 50 additional Euros to get a non-smoking room! All in all, not a great location and a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good place but average service”
Reviews.Author: pegasustr
Reviews.Content: I stayed one as my typical hotels in Istanbul was overbooked. The hotel is mid-old 5 star hotel. It is independent, not amember of any hotel chains. The service quality and the size of the rooms needs improvment (if you consider its competitor in Istanbul. it is for central european 4-5 star level) quite good restourant and some times with live music and in some cases with local famous persons. Lower level of the hotel is quite noisy and strongly recommend to go as high as possible, several floors were "smoking" areas. As it is currenly not allowed I guess these floors are now nonsmookers but it will likely smell. My room was nosmokers area but was just like smookers.

Reviews.Title: “Sucked”
Reviews.Author: elephant69
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about chosing this one . It is not even a 4 stars hotel . There are much more better hotels in the city .

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: Biff'ed
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights on a business trip with leisure at the side. Staff at the lobby Ok, business like not really warm and friendly. A tour desk was open late at night which we immediately booked an entire day trip of Istanbul which turned out to be quite good and covered the Hagia Sophia, Blue mosque, roman forum, Turkish museum, lunch, suleyman mosque and the topkapi palace and the market. Of course, what city tour would not be complete without the waste of time in a shop trying to share you their wares which one would usually expect from a booked city tour - in Istanbul it is carpets. But overall, the basics were covered in just the one free day we had. The location was a bit far from the tourism side of istanbul- a long taxi ride away and from 3 or 4 taxi rides I experience, istanbul taxi drivers do try to talk to you about the sites and seem to be kind but don't speak a word of English. All however are reckless and you tend to hold on whatever handle your hands can hold on to. Also, there are quite a few hotels in Istanbul were there is a Plaza in the name, this one is just plainly The Plaza hotel. Be sure to specify the address - Barbaros Boulevard. Room had a nice view of the Bosporus bridge connecting asia with europe. Meals at the hotel restaurant was fair. You get to taste the local dishes and just about every possible way eggs can be cooked. nice cheese platter and a taste of raki. Meat dishes were quite limited, at least during the 3 or so meals i had there. A convenience store is located a few meters towards the right after you exit the hotel, located near a petrol station. Business/meeting rooms and service are satisfactory. Overall, the hotel is satisfactory although not top notch. If you have business to attend to in the nearby area, I would recommend it but if you are in Istanbul as a tourist I'm sure there are more hotels which have better locations near the tourist centers.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable hotel beds ever”
Reviews.Author: traveler1Uk
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, we upgraded our room, the first room we saw was fine but by upgrading we could use the business center where we had snacks and drinks included and we also had a seperate area for breakfast which is one of the best spreads i have seen in a hotel. The room was big and the view was amazing, the bed was the comfiest bed i have ever had in a hotel, as were the pillows. The restaurant food was good although service was slow and hard to get a waiter while eating our meal to top up drinks. The reception was very helpful when i needed to get to a pharmacy late in the evening and they even called to translate what i needed and it was waiting for me when i arrived. The only thing I didnt like was they took a big deposit off my credit card when we checked in much more than the cost of the room, that they say will be refunded when you check out, it seems to have been but this is a very strange system and not very customer friendly.

Reviews.Title: “it was a business trip but a pleasant one.”
Reviews.Author: Carmenutzz
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very nice, comfortable rooms, clean and stuff but i did not like the fact that is has no views, and the windows of the rooms looked like a fortress!!!

Reviews.Title: “A home in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: S0uth
Reviews.Content: Over the years i have spend more than 150 nights in this hotel and this was by choice. I had always enjoyed excellent service. Rooms are good and their corner suites are even better with a walk-in closet and a big bathroom. High floor rooms offer great views to Bosporus sea Breakfast for my taste is very good. I really enjoy the big variety of fresh fruits The view from the bar in the top floor is excellent Pool and gum are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Finpol
Reviews.Content: Rooms are OK, but if you are a female solo traveller, be careful. You don't exist for the personnel. The service is like 'Do I really have to do that?'. You are not allowed to bring in the hotel own snack (snickers in my case), neither own water, juice etc. So if you bought the bottle of water and haven't managed to drink it to the end - just throw it away. Otherwise you are stopped like a criminal. What more - the rule is not visible/written/ shown anywhere, so you have to guess. Most embarassing was the fact that receptionist hasn't spoken to me, but to my boss who entered the hotel together with me. And I was standing there with my chocolate bar and water without rights to explain anything. Famous Sky bar was closed...

Reviews.Title: “Better than I'd expected from reading older reviews”
Reviews.Author: worktripster
Reviews.Content: The Plaza provided quite a good base from which to see Istanbul. It seems a little far out until you master the local public transport system but from then on it's great. You can travel to the famous sights at the Golden Horn by walking or catching the bus down the road and getting a boat from Bestikas straight to Eminonu which is close to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace etc. There are good sized non-smoking rooms which provide a great view over the Bosphorus and our child was provided with a cot prior to our arrival. The Sky Bar also has amazing panoramic views but is VERY pricey and food in the hotel is pretty good, especially the self-service breakfast in the now non-smoking breakfast room. There are also some nice restaurants nearby, particularly Bilge which is 3 mins walk down the street. Staff are helpful and the gym/pool look great although we didn't use them. NB - rooms can be a little (traffic) noisy at night as the hotel is located by a busy road but really nothing too bad : )

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: BJSMumbai
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent with central location, state of the art service, the restaurant on the top floor have an amazing view, the staff were very courteous and has a very good shopping arcade near the hotel building complex

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but far from everything except business meetings”
Reviews.Author: Ortwin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for business people only. It has everything, but you pay for it. Rooms are decent and large enough. Airco could be better. Meeting rooms are good, well equipped and the staff is friendly and helpful. Location is fine if you like views from 20 stories on the Bosporus Bridge. Otherwise it is bad connected by public transport (certainly from the airport) and the road is a traffic jam most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but could find better for the money!”
Reviews.Author: maymany
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Plaza for 3 nights during a recent business trip to Istanbul. The hotel was booked by local colleagues due to proximity to their office. Overall the stay was okay but there were a number of minor issues. Firstly, the hotel is situated beside a busy junction and has limited space in front which makes drop off and pick up difficult. Our taxi had to carry out some delicate maneouvres to get to the front door. On checking in we were advised that the main restaurant was closed but as we were eating out this did not present a problem. Rooms are okay but with some frustrations. The in room safe deposit box was very small, too small for a laptop computer. Also limited power points - the only socket available for was the shaver socket in the bathroom. Best feature of the hotel is the sky bar on the 20th floor which provides spectacular views of Istanbul. However, the room rate, bar and other facilities in the hotel seem very expensive even by big city standards. No major issues with the hotel but I will look for better value for money on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Much better then other reviews here would indicate!”
Reviews.Author: AuxTx
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by local business contact and I was a little concermed after reading some of the reviews here but after my visit I am now confused!?? Staff was curteous, hotel and rooms were clean, gym had everything I needed, the breakfast had a huge selection to accomodate any diet and the price was good. The Grand Hyatt is was not but I am nearly 100% certain you don't get the full breakfast buffet spread included in the price of your room at the Hyatt either! The Plaza Hotel Istanbul is a very good, local business class hotel and I will stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Business Like”
Reviews.Author: Charlville
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was full so I was booked here. Nice hotel, rooms a little small, food nice, very helpful

HotelInfo.Name: Plaza Hotel Istanbul
HotelInfo.Address: Barbaros Bulvary 165 | Balmumcu / Besiktas, Istanbul, Turkey
